subject: Re: Can Junit do coverage analysis?
msgSnippet: ... NoUnit can be useful (I talk a bit about it and use it in my new TDD book), but it has limitations. 1) it only goes to the method level 2) it does static
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Thomas Stankus Jr." <tjstankus@y...> wrote:
> > 2) If junit can not be used to do coverage analysis, do anybody now
> > a good open source tool can do so?
>
> You might want to look into NoUnit - http://nounit.sourceforge.net/

NoUnit can be useful (I talk a bit about it and use it in my new TDD
book), but it has limitations.

1) it only goes to the method level
2) it does static analysis
3) it stops at interfaces
4) there hasn't been any files released in over a year

The idea of having the depth (how many calls between the test & the
method) shown is interesting and somewhat useful.

Better is to use a statelment/line level runtime coverage tool like
Clover (which I also talk about & use in the book).

Dave
